result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Belinda Vara Sleben

defendant.name: Sleben, Belinda Vara
defendant.address: 141 E Emmett St  Upper Apartment, Portage, WI 53901

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution Stipulation in the probation amount of $300.00 and total amount of $330.00
and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant/counsel

Defendant Belinda Vara Sleben in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 2 in 15 CF 182, Judgment to be entered, 14 CF 449 dismissed, read in, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 1 in 15 CF 182 dismissed, 15 CF 182, Ct. 2, Court withholds sentence, probation 1 year, $443.00 costs, $330.00 Restitution, bond to be applied, 5 days sentence credit,

Cases called: 14CF449 & 15CF182,  Defendant Belinda Vara Sleben in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reset requested.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Atty Dolch requested a new pretrial and return date.  Defendant continues to waive time limits.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 03:10 pm.  Return date scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
